hints.content:
We know the $\greenD{\text{total}}$:

There are $\greenD{24}$ lemons.


And we know the $\purpleC{\text{size of the groups}}$:

There are $\purpleC{6}$ lemons per jar.

The quotient will tell us the $\blueD{\text{number of groups}}$.

In this problem, the $\blueD{\text{number of groups}}$ is the $\blueD{\text{number of jars}}$.
The quotient tells us the $\blueD{\text{number of jars}}$.

question.content:
Clayton has $24$ lemons. He puts them into jars with $6$ lemons each.

**What does the expression $24\div6$ represent?**
